alert.note: Alert for Carter; Custer; Fallon (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 4:02PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN FALLON...SOUTHEASTERN CUSTER AND NORTHERN CARTER COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM MDT... At 400 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 26 miles northeast of Volborg to near Camp Crook. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated and automated observations continue to report wind gusts around 50 mph with this activity. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible with the stronger cells. Locations impacted include... Ekalaka, Webster, Medicine Rocks State Park, Willard, and Mill Iron. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for southeastern Montana.
